intro: Halosarcia entrichoma, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its small, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has a sprawling growth habit with hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Halosarcia entrichoma plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
